snippet: Citing “egregious conduct” in text messages and emails between two lawyers, a federal judge scrapped a proposed $75 million settlement between American Express and a group of retailers.
abstract: Judge Nicholas G Garaufis of United States District Court in Brookly rejects proposed $75 million class-action settlement between American Express and retailers who wish to charge consumers more for using company's credit cards; cites communications between lawyers Gary Friedman and Keila Ravelo that included confidential information; decision could have ripple effect for larger settlement between same merchants and Visa and MasterCard that was made in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Citing “egregious conduct” in text messages and emails between two lawyers, a federal judge scrapped a proposed $75 million settlement between American Express and a group of retailers.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Settlement in American Express Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Settlement in American Express Case
